title: Antitrust Authorities Take Aim at Private-Equity Healthcare Deals
sub_head: The FTC restricts some investments by JAB Consumer Partners
body:
U.S. antitrust enforcers on Monday took action against a private-equity firm they say sought to stifle competition, in what regulators suggest could be the first strike against allegedly anticompetitive behavior by buyout firms in the healthcare sector.
Members of the Federal Trade Commission and the Justice Departmentâ€™s antitrust division have recently accused the private-equity industry of suppressing competition by acquiring healthcare businesses, an area in which the Biden administration has said it intends to act against...
